channel.title: Code problems :P
channel.description:
lol so.... i need a good code for runserver.... my code right now is...
@echo off title EyreScapeV2 Server java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause
and it keeps telling me that java is not recognized as an internal and external command..... i've been trying to do this for so long its annoying.... no matter how many tutorials and stuff i look at, well they're all different so i have no idea what to do and nothing ever works.... so yea.... any help at all would be appreciated
and i already checked and my paths should be good

item.title: Code problems :P
item.dc:creator: @GhoulishCheetah GhoulishCheetah
item.description:
@GhoulishCheetah wrote:

thank you… i love you people forever

Read full topic

item.title: Code problems :P
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“GhoulishCheetah, post:4, topic:402468”]ok i did that and now its saying

javac: invalid flag: -Xmx1024m
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options[/quote]

Javac doesn’t take a memory argument.

Remove the ‘c’ from “javac”.

Read full topic

item.title: Code problems :P
item.dc:creator: @emtrescue emtrescue
item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

vps’ do this also change your code to your path to java like this

[code]@echo off
title EyreScapeV2 Server
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe” -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
pause

[/code]

its how to get vps’ work work also jus take java out and put ur path wala it works

Read full topic

item.title: Code problems :P
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

[quote=“GhoulishCheetah, post:1, topic:402468”]lol so… i need a good code for runserver… my code right now is…

@echo off
title EyreScapeV2 Server
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
pause

and it keeps telling me that java is not recognized as an internal and external command… i’ve been trying to do this for so long its annoying… no matter how many tutorials and stuff i look at, well they’re all different so i have no idea what to do and nothing ever works… so yea… any help at all would be appreciated

and i already checked and my paths should be good[/quote]

had same problem, do you use windows 7? even if you dont, check this out: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7jSb0ZnwaKI
should help
